meanings.definition: Able to be referred to or consulted.
meanings.sent1: The book had a referable index at the back for easy access to information.
meanings.sent2: The expert's opinion was highly referable in making important decisions.
meanings.sent3: It was a referable moment when the teacher pointed out the key details in the lesson.
meanings.sent4: The referable map guided them through the unfamiliar terrain with ease.
meanings.sent5: The referable instructions on the package helped assemble the furniture quickly.

meanings.definition: Worthy of being mentioned or considered.
meanings.sent1: Her achievements were referable during the award ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The referable candidates for the job had impressive qualifications.
meanings.sent3: The referable idea sparked a lively discussion among the group.
meanings.sent4: The referable painting caught the attention of all visitors at the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The referable advice from the mentor proved to be invaluable in times of need.
